alert.note: Alert for City of Lexington; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 2:36PM EDT until August 21 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including Rockbridge County and the city of Lexington. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water will flood over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain earlier today. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is already occurring. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Alone Mill Creek, Big Marys Creek, Gordons Run, Gilmer Creek, Colliers Creek, Buffalo Creek, Dry Branch, Falling Run, Cedar Grove Branch, and Cold Run. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington... Rockbridge Baths... Fairfield... Brownsburg... Vesuvius... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
